intro: Zygophyllum emarginatum, commonly known as the marginate zygophyllum, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often forming dense colonies in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are usually fleshy and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss, while its flowers are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Zygophyllum emarginatum is well adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing desert soils.
